title: Stan Storton
text:
Stanley Eugene Storton (born 5 January 1939) is an English former <a href="association%20football">football</a> player and manager.
Personal life.
Born in <a href="Keighley">Keighley</a>, Storton is the older brother of fellow professional player <a href="Trevor%20Storton">Trevor Storton</a>. Following his management career, Storton ran an office cleaning firm in Ellesmere Port.
Career.
Playing career.
Storton, who played as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">full back</a>, began his career at <a href="Huddersfield%20Town%20A.F.C.">Huddersfield Town</a> as an amateur. He turned professional in 1959, appearing in <a href="the%20Football%20League">the Football League</a> for <a href="Bradford%20City%20A.F.C.">Bradford City</a>, <a href="Darlington%20F.C.">Darlington</a>, <a href="Hartlepool%20United%20F.C.">Hartlepool United</a> and <a href="Tranmere%20Rovers%20F.C.">Tranmere Rovers</a>, before dropping into non-league football with <a href="Ellesmere%20Port%20Town%20F.C.">Ellesmere Port Town</a>.
Coaching career.
After retiring as a player, Storton managed a number teams including <a href="Ellesmere%20Port%20Town%20F.C.">Ellesmere Port Town</a>, <a href="Runcorn%20F.C.%20Halton">Runcorn</a>, <a href="Bangor%20City%20F.C.">Bangor City</a>, <a href="Northwich%20Victoria%20F.C.">Northwich Victoria</a> and <a href="Telford%20United%20F.C.">Telford United</a>.
Honours.
<a href="National%20League%20%28division%29">Football Conference</a> Manager of the Month: <a href="1986%E2%80%9387%20Football%20Conference">October 1986</a>
